---
name: global-coding-style
description: Write Python and Django code following PEP 8 conventions, proper naming patterns, import organization, and project formatting standards using black and isort. Use this skill when writing any Python code, organizing imports, naming variables/functions/classes, structuring ViewSets or model classes, writing docstrings, configuring linters and formatters, or ensuring code follows the project's style guide.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When writing new Python functions, classes, or modules
- When organizing imports in Python files
- When naming variables, functions, classes, or constants
- When structuring Django ViewSets, Views, or Model classes
- When writing docstrings using Google format
- When configuring black, isort, or flake8 settings
- When reviewing code for style consistency
- When deciding between absolute and relative imports
- When organizing methods within a class (ordering conventions)
- When working on pyproject.toml or .flake8 configuration
- When writing type hints for function signatures
- When refactoring code to follow DRY principles
- When creating custom QuerySets or Managers

# Global Coding Style

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle global coding style.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
